review: I've been here several times being from the DC area. There's only a handful of Fridays close to me, this being one of those locations. This review is *mostly* based on my most recent experience. My best friend and I came over from the shopping center across the street wanting some good bar food for lunch. Of course, the restaurant was less populated than it is at night or on the weekend, but it was still pretty busy. Our server was great and it wasn't super loud per the norm.  We ordered The Fridays Combo with boneless bbq wings, loaded potato skins and mozzarella sticks. The only thing I was disappointed with on the appetizer were that the potato skins were pretty dry and sour cream wasn't put as a dip (which I think it is supposed to make an appearance?). I ordered the Chicken Quesadilla as my entree and I've honestly had better. 6/10.  Overall, I recommend this location, especially if you're going to get a drink and catch a game at the bar. The bartenders are pretty nice and make a good drink, too.

Eh my experience has been so so here. no bad customer service but i don't really have high standards for t.g.i. friday's . I overall had an ok experience but it could've been better . this would be a 3.5 Star  Came to the bar and ordered my favorite strawberry henny, delicious and refreshing  ! the appetizers took awhile , but the bartenders were attentive and friendly . I did feel like we were forgotten about a few times ? We had the jack sliders and the buffalo wings apps . The wings were a little spicy but the meat was good. My sliders were delicious ! I'll come back just for the drinks but the staff was really friendly ! Plenty of room .

horrible. the bartenders and I say bartenders because this goes for every last one of them behind the bar. THEY HAD NO IDEA WHAT WAS ON THEIR MENU.  To start we sat at the bar for 5 minutes before being acknowledged and once we finally got the attention of the young woman working she asked if we wanted to order appetizers...? I responded with "yes, we would like to order drinks first, because we've been sitting here waiting." I asked her for the Proficiency Pinot Noir - which was on their Happy Hour menu. She brought me back white wine. I asked her. "Is this the Pinot Noir?" she said "yes."  PINOT NOIR IS A RED WINE. I coached her by letting her know this and she returned with a glass of Meiomi.  Although this is not the listed wine on their Happy Hour I was tired of telling someone how to do their job. My boyfriend ordered a Budlight- also on Happy Hour. The bartender comes back and announces that he has a tall Miller lite. We gave it back to him without drinking it and asked for it be replaced with a Blue Moon (also on Happy Hour) he came back with a fresh beer and all was great.  We ordered the basket of bones, which was delicious but before we could enjoy we had to ask for silverware and the ranch and blue cheese that was to come with our appetizer. I'm disappointed because TGI is such a fun, nice place to come where the food is good and the drinks are tasty. But the Rockville Pike staff have no idea what's on their menu to sell and have zero to no hospitality. GET IT TOGETHER.

Oh man oh man. TGI Fridays. I haven't been here in ages. We got seated right away. Ordered our drinks and asked for a few more minutes to look at the menu. They have so many options on their menu. After we knew what we wanted, we waited for our waiter to come back. Everytime he passed by our table, I would look at him hoping to catch his attention and he completely would avoid eye contact with me. Finally he came back and took our orders.  We ordered the appetizer platter - chicken wings and mozzarella sticks and the cajun shrimp and chicken pasta (half size).  I saw a waiter and waitress just chillin, sitting with their friends talking. Not paying attention to any of their tables. Just chatted up for a bit. They would leave here and there, but I never seen such poor service at a restaurant. The food took forever to come.... and once it did come, the half size pasta for $10 was really small. It comes in a small little pan. The pasta wasn't bad at all, but for $10 and the size we got was not worth it. When we received our food, we didn't get any utensils or napkins. My small pasta came with a spoon... why would you give someone a spoon to eat pasta? .... It took forever to flag down our waiter because he was too busy talking to his friends. Finally received our utensils.. and finally we ate... Terrible awful service. Food took forever. Don't think I'll be coming back.

The only thing good about this place is that it has one of my favorite pasta dishes and unlimited appetizers. However, nothing else about this restaurent is good. The host and bartenders are rude and even though I constantly returned, I will no longer give them my service.  Sunday night we were at Friday's and the waitress decided to give herself a $30 tip when our food only came to $25. Now I have to dispute the charge and on top of that, right before the restaurent closed they start blasting music, turn up the lights and made it evident they wanted everyone to leave. It was a Sunday and the bartender put on her personal music with so much profanity I thought the manager was going to come out and cut it off --- but that didn't happen. I'm done with Friday's. Never again.
Took them forever to find my online order. Food definitely doesn't match the description. Here are a few photos to show it. Girl at the front desk was very nice and friendly.
If I could rate lower I would. Not only are they rude, especially D'Emily [sp] the "manager"  but she is completely inexperienced.  Plenty of options on the pike, drive and extra mile!

Only reason to give a start was our waiter who tried to accommodate us and be as nice as possible. We made a reservation 4 days ahead for 12 only to get to the restaurant and learn they did not take it. We had to wait over 40 minutes to get seated for another 30 to get the order and another 30 for the food. Our waiter even though very personable seem to have a lot of tables to take care of as we hardly saw him. Meanwhile 2-3 waiters were talking and texting at the hostess table all the time. Will never come back and wouldn't recommend anybody to either.

Stopped here after work and the place was packed on a Thursday.  I grabbed a seat @ bar:  $5 apps M-Th.  Also Thursdays special is full rack of ribs on special (options for Jack Daniels or BBQ).  The bar is crowded so you gotta be patient for your order--but its worth it. I ordered traditional wings (6 buffalo and 6 parmesan), which was excellent; and rack of ribs, which as on point.  Thats a lot of food--but its still good for lunch on tomorrow.

I wish I could give 0 stars. I have never had such a terrible experience at a restaurant in my life- and I've been to some pretty awful places. Every single employee we encountered tonight from the host, the servers(we saw about 6 different ones at our table over the course of the night) and managers were all incredibly rude and disrespectful. I have never left a business as angry as I was tonight. We were here for 2+ hours for the worst service ever. The appetizers were good, but there was hair in my food and my husbands food was cold. If you would like to hear the full story I would be glad to share with you detail for detail but it's too much to type on here. They would be better off firing everyone and starting fresh!  DO NOT GO HERE. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME. DO NOT EAT HERE. DO NOT GIVE THEM YOUR MONEY. DO NOT DO NOT DO NOT GO HERE. WORST EXPERIENCE EVER!!!!!

Started off great  ! Female bartender didn't know what the hell she was doing ! Order a strawberry henny the first was made by John was excellent . This unprofessional little girl made the second drink with another type of liquor not henny as request . After informing her I didn't want this drink she throw the drink in the floor. Her behavior was deplorable and she needs to be trained on a customer service sensitivity class on treatment for all Minorities. This place has horrible reviews . I understand  why !!!!

I order through bitesquad all the time and I thought your food didn't taste fresh especially more recently. But today we ordered and I guess you guys forgot to take the sticker off my food that said it was prepared DAYS ago and was SUPPOSE to be used yesterday by the end of the day. You all should be shut down that's disgusting. I'm not paying all this  money for expired, hard food. Not ordering from here again.

My boyfriend and I usually come here on Wednesday nights because it's one of the few restaurants that are open late. The food is what you'd typically expect from Fridays and the service is usually good, even during busy hours. They usually have specials from time to time that are worth it, like the endless appetizers. Overall, it's a good place to eat if looking for a restaurant that is open late nights.

I come to this location for its nicer than the one closet to me. I drive out of my way for the good service and the food! It's always extremely hot in here!! I'm sweating just sitting here. Unfortunately I have to cut my lunch short. It's unbearable sitting here. I've told two servers if they could turn the air up, and there's been no change.    Serv

I would give this place 5 stars if I was dining it. Disappointing how a to-go house salad was dry and I threw it away. I could have gone to a grocery store and made a better looking/tasting salad than this.
Went there for a dinner superbowl game night. I ordered the shrimp pasta, overall it was pretty good. I wish the balsamic dressing was on the side and not all over the pasta. It was a bit sweet.

Very unprofessional, everyone seems to be more inclined to socialize than actually serve and I had a horrible experience thanks to one subconsciously rude waitress on my mom's birthday. Save your hard earned money and stay far, FAR away from this place! As far as humanly possible. If I could give zero stars, I would in a flash.

1st time to this location & although my Warriors lost, my visit was a win. Before I could settled in my bar seat, Richie the Bartender was cleaning the area down thoroughly. While he was place setting he asked what I wanted, kudos for multitasking. & of course, great customer service from the door...coming & going.  Bianca another Bartender stepped in & provided awesome service as well. I don't frequent TGIF often as their menu is pretty limited for my preferences yet I could see myself returning for the Alamos wine & veggie crudités they made specially for me, much obliged.  I would be even more obliged if restaurants like this would have just one dedicated fryer for French Fries, Potato Skins & such, as that would my visits more frequent. :-)
Waiter was very nice but the food came out over done then raw...... We won't be going back there again!

This place sucks and my Wife loves it which sucks even more. Maybe it's all the red but ugh. The drinks are expensive and weak as hell. They took off the only app I really loved since I don't eat meat (the Tuna Tostadas) off the menu. I come here by force and leave hating it just a little more every single time.

I love Fridays! They have the best deals...not really the best food...but when a martini is in my hands for $3 I really can't complain! They have daily drink specials where you can usually get a decent choice of drinks $3 - $5. They have great specials on appetizers too! Sign up for their Stripes card.  They send you coupons in your email for different discounts on entrees and you save up points for discounts, free dessert, free entrees and more.  The service is hit or miss both in the bar and at a table. The employees tend to have a bit of an attitude. The food is decent as far as chain restaurants go.  Just keep your $3 drinks coming in and you will be fine. :)

Been a couple times but after this visit probably won't be back. Food was alright wish they didn't stuff everything in my quesadilla at the bottom of it. Worst part was the people at the bar were so loud screaming at the tv literally screaming and running around. With all the noise it takes away from your dinner experience. "Oh well"

My brother and I came I for lunch and were very much disappointed. We got the Friday combo appetizer, and the potato skins were so over done the celery was easier to bite into. Our sever, Albert, was very pleasant when he was at the table but had no sense of urgency so we made no complaints. For entrees my brother ordered a burger medium and it came well done. I had a fried chicken sandwich and the chicken itself was absolutely disrespectful. The edges so black it looked like beef at first. I picked off some edges and we waited for our server to appear. He was taking a while so we started to eat and he didn't come back until we were halfway finished so once again we decided not to say anything. In all the service was lacking and the kitchen seems to need to pay closer attention to how long they're cooking the food.

I keep giving this cesspool several chances but this is my last time. Yesterday I order $80 of pick up food and was told it will be ready at a certain time. I got there 15 after the appointed time just in case but I soon as I told the little girl seating people I was picking up, she told me to sit.  After another almost 15 minutes, I confronted her and lucking the "manager" or person-in-charge showed up and rudely told me he will check. He came back with my food, no thank you, no nothing.  The food was warm which meant it was sitting there for a while but princessa and her boyfriend didn't want to get it. These idiots are not fit to work in a food industry, they are SLOW, RUDE and almost enjoy telling people to sit rather than help them.

The service was great, but the place was in need of a good cleaning, from the dirty mop smell that hit you when you walked in the door to the dirty wall at our table.  As for the food, the broccoli was brown, the mashed potatoes were lacking cheese but the steak was good.  I will never go back to this location.

Come here now and again. This time was for lunch at the bar. Service was a tad slow.  When our meals came out,  I had hair in my salad.  It took over 20 minutes to replace the salad.  By the time it arrived,  my lunch buddy had finished his meal. They took care of the salad and a round of drinks I. Return for the service failure,  but not the experience I am looking for when I eat out for lunch!

Hmph. TGI Fridays? More like WTH Fridays! This was my first time at this location but Fridays is like McDonald's bigger brother. The food usually tastes the same regardless of which one you go to. I don't know what happened at this one though. My friends brought me here for my birthday. They suggested sushi but NO I just had to request a place that had drinks, appetizers, desserts, and a lot of noise because I was planning to turn up...on a budget (hence Fridays).  First off the waiter was very personable. He was a cool guy who told us we'd come to the right place to celebrate because just that night they were having a bartending competition, so the drinks would be phenomenal.  Riiiight. How about 'no,' Scott? Scene 1: Drinks My margarita tasted like dirty dish water. I don't know what the hell went wrong with that. There was zero alcohol in it and if it hadn't been for the fact that it was frozen I would actually think that it was dirty dish water. My friends also hated their drinks as well. No getting drunk for us.  Scene 2: The appetizer... Spinach artichoke dip. Had it millions of times before. My first bite, something sharp went up into the sweet spot between my teeth and gums. I spent a few minutes pulling sharp artichoke "thingamajigs" (bristles?) out of my gum. Imagine a bunch of shredded tooth picks. The chips were hard as hell too.  Scene 3: The entree... I got old faithful, Sizzling chicken and shrimp. The chicken was overcooked by a lot. Like...dry on the inside, super dry and chewy on the outside. The shrimp were okay.  I decided to not even waste my time with dessert. I ended up going to another restaurant afterwards for that.  The ONLY saving grace for this place was the manager, Jake. He happened to be going around to various tables asking about our experience. My friends were paying and I didn't want to seem ungrateful, so I just smiled and nodded. One of my friends, however, told him about the drinks. He apologized profusely and said that we should've sent them back. He offered to take the drinks off the bill and gave us a coupon for a free appetizer on our next visit. He took them up to two stars.

First time at this location and was impressed food and drink wise, ehhm, very impressed with the bartender. Came in at around 5pm and sat at one of the booths with a very attentive, welcoming server. She was quick to get drinks and food out. I recommend trying the endless appetizers and the cocktails and do try the Peach sangria, loved it!
They don't know the difference between sirloin and ribeye. Their service is horrible no knowledge of their own menu....
A great place to hang out with friends. To celebrate an especial occasion, like birthdays. The food it's delicious with great costumer service.

I love all types of dishes, but this place has the worst. I never liked their food, there's absolutely no flavor whatsoever. The only time I visit this place is only when I'm hanging out with friends or cowworkers, other than that I would never crave the food at TGIF.

Not sure why there are so many bad reviews of this place, it was quite good. I went with a group of four and it did not disappoint any of us, though the portions were so large that we all got to-go boxes! I had the lobster and flat iron steak dish and the steak was great, cooked rare perfectly and tender with healthy chunks of lobster on top. Their mac & cheese had a nice mild cheesy flavor as well. A hit with our group in particular were the fried green bean appetizers and the french onion soup. The only few issues perhaps I would talk about were that our waiter took a long time to check on us during the meal to bring us the check and take-out boxes, the bathroom had an overly strong cleaning smell, and the ribs were a bit dry. (Nothing unfixable though). Great place, will definitely go again! Overall service was decent, especially given that it was a crowded evening, and it was an enjoyable dining experience taste and atmosphere-wise.
Servers are kinda busy to notice you. I even tried to call the hostess to ask for some assistance but she just hung up on me without her knowing I was watching her.

This was my first time at this location and will most likely be my last! The restaurant was not crowded at all for a Saturday at lunch time which was great. That being said we waited over 10 minutes to even be acknowledged by the waitress. My friend ordered 2 lemonades both had to be sent back they tasted nothing like lemonade. Then our spinach dip was served cold and had clearly been overheated and was burned and stiff ... this had to be sent back. Then out food came and my burger was missing toppings. This place is a train wreck like most Fridays.
Tanja catered for me and did a really good job. I highly recommend her services to anyone.

This is only for the service.  My co workers I came here today at 11:55 am and the hostess asked how many people and I informed her party of 6.  Meanwhile the rest of the party showed up and then a couple came behind them.  She then proceed to attend to the couple first and then I stood up from the waiting area to let her know that we are all here and still waiting.  Another 3 people showed up and she went to attend to them instead.  Another hosting person showed up and I told him that the hostess has ignored us when we were here first and took two different parties to their table while we are still waiting and asked to see the manager.  He then told me if you're waiting to see the manager then let me take these folks behind you first and I was shocked at his response.  After 4 tables ahead of us were attended to, our waiter showed up and told us to follow him.  At that time, the manager showed up and asked what's wrong.  I told him that we have been here over 10 minutes waiting to be seated and that the hostess and host has repeatedly ignored us and finally the waiter showed up to take us to our seats. Someone needs to go back to "Customer Service School".  The waiter did apologized many times.

***edit*** the waiter's name was kweku and was very nice and apologized several times for the inconvenience caused on us. This is only for the service, or lack thereof.  My colleagues and I came here today at 11:55 am and the hostess asked how many people and I informed her party of 6.  Then the phone rang and I told her she can take the call first as we are still waiting for the rest of the folks to come.  She then proceed to take the call and then the phone rang again so she went to attend the call.  Meanwhile the rest of the party showed up and then a couple came behind them.  She then proceed to attend to the couple first and then I stood up from the waiting area to let her know that we are all here and still waiting.  Another 3 people showed up and she went to attend to them instead.  Another hosting person showed up and I told him that the hostess has ignored us when we were here first and took two different parties to their table while we are still waiting and asked to see the manager.  He then told me if you're waiting to see the manager then let me take these folks behind you first and I was shocked at his response.  After 4 tables ahead of us were attended to, our waiter showed up and told us to follow him.  At that time, the manager showed up and asked what's wrong.  I told him that we have been here over 10 minutes waiting to be seated and that the hostess and host has repeatedly ignored us and finally the waiter showed up to take us to our seats.  I'm flabbergasted at this type of customer service.  The waiter has apologized to us a few times and so far was very courteous.  If I get his name, I'll update this post later on.

Sooooooo let me get straight to point food good service Sucked. My boyfriend and i werent checked on by our waitress Elly until more then half our food was done to get offered another drink or if our food was even good. She took forever to cash us out. She gave a response with "Well you could have asked someone else" very unprofessional... Customer Service Classes i think are needed

I came here twice in the past few months. The service was not so great the first time our server got cut half way through our dinner and we got a better server but still waters were not filled and we were not approached often. We wanted to order more food, but they took forever to come back to our table. The second time we sat at the bar and the bartender was super friendly and attentive to us.    The first time we stuck with appetizers. We got the mozzarella sticks- good, can't mess those up too bad. The pot stickers were good, that was my favorite out of the 3. Then we got the wings, which were ok, I'm not that big on wings.  The second time I came we only got dessert. We started with the brownie sundae. I must say super good! The brownie was soft and almost gooey but not under baked. Of course this was too small for me and my friend to share so we also got the oreo madness dessert. This was good, not amazing. If you like cookies and cream ice cream this would be for you! We asked for extra chocolate sauce and the bartender gave us the whole bottle to use! That was really awesome we doused that in chocolate. This has vanilla ice cream layered between oreo cookie crust.  I would definitely get the brownie sundae again (maybe 2!) but everything else I would probably skip, dessert was my favorite though!

So this is my 2nd review of this Friday's location and I'm sorry to say it's actually gotten worse then before,the bartender staff is really bad,when I first sat down at the bar I waited almost 20 minutes before a bartender ask me what I wanted,the bartenders have 0 customer service skills,after getting my 1st drink it's was 35 minutes before any one of them came back to me,and it was not busy at all,I like Friday's but this location just sucks!

Had not been here in years! Glad I decided to go back and try it again. Honestly, I was not expecting for the best food but I tried the jack Daniels ribeye and it was amazing! The waiter was so helpful in finding me the perfect tasting beer to go with my steak! Overall great service
Great place. Cheap drinks and great food....well just don't get the steaks cooked medium rare but everything thing else is cool after a good workout at the gym lol

A nice place to hang out on the weekends if you don't have anything else to do.  They have pretty good service, food quality is good and they have special deals (like, Endless Apps) and rewards if you're a TGIF member.  Their friction' dessert, the Brownie Obsession is simply one of the best things to devour!  So wickedly tasty!  Usually order it with the ample amount of food and drinks.  A hot spot on Friday/Saturday nights, though...  But they usually seat people quickly since it's a big enough space to hold a lot of parties.
the food here is always good!! if you go here for happy hour Amena or Bianca are the ladies to see!! They treat you right... Great price and amazing drinks

Walked in to have dinner. Service was good just a little slow I ordered the ribs and sesame chicken it was good but not great I remember a time when the ribs were better I liked it all but still came out a little disappointed in any case there's room for improvement.

Food is good here! Service could be a little quicker but it is a Saterday night! We like the apps/great bartender's tonight,the have worked on the menu and it  looks much better. I wish they would tell you the sizebof the steak over all good!

TGI Friday's is mediocre no matter which way you cut it. We knew that going into this dinner. But, my brother was in town for one night and staying down the street so we came from VA to meet him (big mistake, Maryland, as far as states go, is mediocre itself) for a quick dinner. There were 6 of us ... myself and my husband, my sister and her friend, and my brother and his coworker.   Everything was fine aside from the fact that they were out of pretty much every on-tap beer (literally, we requested 3-4 and somehow, they had "just run out in the last few minutes," yet it was a Sunday night around 9pm, and there weren't that many people there ... but, I digress).  We ordered, got our food ... my brother's coworker finally settled on Mich Ultra, because they were out of a bunch of bottled beer too (seriously!?), and it only took about 20 minutes to get each of his two beers. When it came time to pay our bill, I told the waitress one check was fine, we could split it (as my husband and I were together, my sister and her friend split something but were paying separately, and my brother was paying for his coworker).  She insisted on splitting it for us, and came back with 6 checks.  No big deal, I gave her my credit card wrapped in both my husband's check and mine. When the checks came, everyones appeared to be correct, we signed and left. Well, today, it looks like that waitress didn't charge me for hubby's meal, and wound up closing it out on my sister's credit card (sister is a broke college student who works hard for her money) ... AND she tipped herself MORE than I tipped her.  So, essentially, at the end of the night, she decided she wanted to make more money and tipped herself and extra almost $4. So, my sister, in essence, paid for her meal and my husbands, and tipped this idiot waitress double.  She's disputing the charge with her bank and we've both called the restaurant and spoken to the manager, Amanda (who was very nice and helpful), and she's looking into it. Either way. Even if this WAS a mistake and she did accidentally close out the wrong check on the wrong card, the waitress tipped herself and I'm sorry, but that's shady, dishonest, and frankly ILLEGAL. We've been assured that it'll be taken care of, sister will get her money back, and the waitress will be "handled." But, for what it's worth, stay far away from this place.
Had my bday there! Food was ok ,then server was rood he even didnt bring a water for us

For a chain restaurant, the service was great. They were able to easily accomedated my family and I. I was impressed with the quality and portions of the food each of us ordered. I will gladly continue to do business with TGI Fridays.

At Friday's u know what to expect with the food. What separates them is the service. Well our hostess forgot the silverware and it went downhill from there. Out servers name was Joanne and she had the personality of a brick. She was extremely unattentive and left out leftover dishes as she walked past us several times. When she wasn't doing that she just wasn't around for long stretches! I ordered a steak and she didn't even ask how I wanted it cooked. Not to mention she brought it out without the shrimp. When told of this she acted as if I should get over it. If my husband and I return which is doubtful we will request to not be in Joanne's section!

Despite having an abundance of staff at their disposal, service moved at a snails pace. The young servers and runners were often seen loafing around the drink station enjoying eachother's company, instead of attending to guests. The descriptions of the dishes were sometimes incomplete, and the staff isn't as knowledgable as they should be.  Despite the half price appetizer deal on the menu, the receipt did not reflect the deal and we almost didn't catch their almost 10$ mistake.  I likely would not return here again, and definitely not recommend it to friends. Bring back the old Fridays, it was vastly superior to this iteration.

I know it's a large chain, so take every experience with a grain of salt. Even having very low expectations, they still managed to surprise me with how terrible they are. Because we had read the reviews about this location, we did not go until recently. One evening, we just wanted drinks and dessert. We heard if we sit at the bar the service was much better, so we did follow that advice. Let me just preface this, with whoever is in charge of writing the menu descriptions at corporate headquarters, wherever they are, is the only one doing their job right apparently. This is what we read online (viewed on our phones so images did not load. you know, flash...) "Oreo® Madness Cookies and Cream ice cream sandwiched between layers of Oreo® cookie crust with caramel and fudge." Okay, that sounds pretty good. Here's how our experience went down: Sunday afternoon, and while a football game was on, it was neither Redskins nor Ravens, therefore, really wasn't that busy. And there were 3 bartenders. We were there 10 minutes before being acknowledged. We asked what the drink specials were, the only thing we were told was $3 Budweiser/Bud Light. My boyfriend settled for Bud light and I just ordered bottled beer. But then we read the specials menu, and sure enough, there were rail drink and cocktail specials they did not tell us about, that were still going on for 2+ more hours. We ordered our desserts. And my boyfriend's "Oreo Madness" came out, and it was simply a Klondike Oreo Ice Cream sandwich, with some hershey's syrup drizzled on the plate. The same exact ice cream sandwiches that you can buy by the 6 pack for $2.50 at the grocery store.  So much for "layers of cookie crust with caramel and fudge" because there was not even a hint of caramel anywhere on the plate. Lesson learned won't do that again. Despite this, we decided to stay for another drink or two.  THIS WAS BY FAR THE WORST PART Of the THREE bartenders working, every single one of them was completely IGNORING us.  As soon as we would make eye contact with them, they instantly turned around and walked the other direction. All of them did this at least 5 times. Then, when we ordered the rail drinks that were on special, they rolled their eyes and acted like it was the biggest inconvenience in the world for them to make them. It was 15 minutes before we got our second drinks. Then it took 20 minutes and more than 5 more times of getting ignored after making eye contact, that we could get our check. I'm even surprised my boyfriend left a tip, because the service was so terrible, if I were the one that picked up the tab, they would have gotten a big fat ZERO. I will never go to another TGI Fridays in my life.

The most amazing ribs you will ever have! My mind was completely blown the first time I went here last week that I had to come back again for my anniversary. This is probably the first time I've had ribs literally fall off the bone, and I have never had the opportunity to eat ribs with a fork hah! Seeing as ribs are my favorite food, this restaurant is now a staple in my life! Everything they serve is superb, the cole slaw is delicious and their fries are golden and godly. The service is a bit slow, even on a so-so busy Wednesday night, but not a big deal as the waiters/waitresses are very nice and will come by every so often to ask how you are doing or for refills. Definitely check this place out!!

I love TGI Friday's! This location is not one I would ever go to again though. I went for my birthday and when they brought out of favorite (the sizzling chicken and shrimp) a cochroach crawled out of my mashed potatos. :( The manager offered me a free meal which I did appretiate but I was not able to eat anything after seeing that. I have been back once for drinks but that is as far as I will go.

Chains are always hit or miss to review.  For one thing, while your experience at one should be the same across the board, due to franchising and staff it's impossible to guarantee this.  So, the intent of creating a cookie-cutter event isn't always achievable.  Another reason I'm always leery about reviewing chains, because of their prevalence, one typically has an expectation when visiting any location. So it was with T.G.I.Friday's, which was the destination after an event at a local Rockville hangout.  I have to admit, this was a bit above my expectations, though still close enough to them to warrant the rating. PROS:  * The servers were very friendly, and I think everyone's order was accurate (we were a big table).  I'll reference the drink situation in the CONS below. * My pretzel sticks were really good, some of the best I've ever had.  There was a light crispy exterior, almost like a fried coating, though probably butter glazed.  But super fresh and warm and soft.  The beer cheese dip was a great side for them.  I'd order these again. * Parking was pretty easy to find, even on busy Rockville Pike.  The lot has a lot of spaces, though I would be cautious during holidays.  I'm sure it gets packed then. * Décor was fun, and not too over-the-top. CONS: * There was a problem with our drinks.  A few people ordered beers, and because they brought them out all at the same time without any way of differentiating them, they got mixed up, and nobody knew which beer was whose.  Very sloppy. * The rest of the food I tried (we all did a bunch of apps) was only okay.  The mozzarella sticks were actually very bland.  The marinara was likewise almost flavorless.  The buffalo wings were okay, mildly spicy and well cooked.  But nothing was really that awe-inspiring, or even that noteworthy (aside from my aforementioned pretzel sticks). * We were sat in the room with the sloped glass ceiling.  The lights were almost touching our heads even though we were seated.  Very poor design. * The restroom was filthy.  I went once to wash my hands when we arrived, and the condition was unchanged about two hours later as we were leaving. There were definitely some pluses, but not enough for me to rave about this place.  It was decent, a normal TGIF experience from my own personal expectations.  Which, admittedly, are typically not very high at all.

BP took me to Fridays to finally try their Unlimited Apps menu for $12. Our waitress Johanna took a while to get to our table (about 20 minutes) which had me mad, but once she started serving us, the excellent customer service did not stop! Haven't been in a Fridays in years...but sometimes the world spins in funny ways and we ended up here on "Game Day" this evening.   The Pike was a nightmare, couldn't find parking at Trader Joes, and just wanted the hell out of dodge!  Using a short cut to get home, we cut through their parking lot, and thought let's eat and get it over with  before going home. Went to CeCe's Pizza first -don't judge, never been there and will never step in their door again- waited way too long in line for what looked like a pretty crappy buffet.  High tailed it out of there and saw the beckoning lights of Friday's.  Fond memories of good times and bar food lured us in, and it was exactly what we were looking for!  Got seated right away and our nice waiter Vinnie was right there to take our drink order....he must know how people feel after getting off the Pike!  Anyway, sat there enjoying big beer schooner and yummy cosmos, and food came right away.  I had the baby back ribs, and wedge salad - hubby had pot stickers and Cobb salad.  Not show stopping, but not awful either - exactly what you expect for a Friday's.  The real reason I'm writing all this is to commend the service!  Our waiter was great, stopped by just enough, made great suggestions, cleared the table right away.  I also saw the manager (or just some guy in a suit) cleaning floors, checking on guests, and just plain keeping the place running smoothly for a busy football watching night.  Surprised by how many folks were there in jerseys, it seemed to be considered the neighborhood joint - which doesn't happen much in Montgomery County - at least not like Chicago from whence I came.  All in all, it turned a cranky girl into a happy one, and will definitely go back when its time for beers, bar food and great service!

TGIFriday's has always been the go-to for late nite munchies! The best thing is you have 2 happy hours...first one during the after work hours and a second one starting at 10pm until close!!! That means almost everything is $5 or half off. Yum! The menu has changed a bit. They now have a "little bites" menu too. Tapas at Fridays. Um. Ok.  I was going to get a burger but decided to try 3 little things. I started with the Thai pork tacos from the little bites menu. They were not kidding when they said "little" bites. As a woman, I finished one of these tiny tacos in 2 bites but let's be honest...you can do it in one. The flavor was o.k. but at $7 I did not think there was value for my money. As it was Tuesday, everything Jack Daniels is $5. Drinks and 3 menu items. I like the sauce so I decided on the sesame jack chicken strips. They were more like long nuggets instead of strips. They were perfectly fried and nicely sauced. Best thing I ordered...but did the serving get smaller because the price did? Let's be honest. I love me some tater skins. I pretty much watched the clock to get to Fridays for the late night happy hour just for some fried wedges of potatoes loaded with cheese, bacon, scallions and sour cream!!! .......WTF??? (Mom, that is "what the fridays???) Some wacko decided to play around with the perfect bar food (next to buffalo wings) and they re-vamped it into some sad lump that Taco Bell wouldn't even serve!  First they mashed the potato and formed it into a triangular yet curved form. Why? Then they fried it up and even though it sound like it would be a delicious potato pancake, it was a dried up, crumbly, messy lump. Then, they put processed cheese in the middle. Huh? I like processed cheese but not on a tater skin. I saw bacon but no scallions. At least there was sour cream. So, most of the yummy elements were still there. I cut off a piece and it crumbles. I spear it with the fork and half falls off. The trick is to pick it up with your fingers.  Bottom line is it does taste yummy. But why mess with perfection? A hollowed out potato half, flash fried and covered with shredded cheddar, bacon and chives. A cute little boat waiting to be topped with sour cream. Fridays...blasphemy!  I may be back for 3 buck Thursdays....but when Chili's right down the street has happy hour from 2pm to 8pm I really don't see the point. Overpriced happy hour food and inattentive service at the bar? Grab some beer at Dietle's and taco bell instead. ps. This was tough for me to write as most of my reviews are positive and 4 stars. I believe that if you have a bad restaurant experience you should tell a manager so they can try to correct it. Trust me, they want you to leave happy.

Not a bad restaurant, but too much money for what you get.  If the price point were a few bucks lower, then it would get a higher rating. That said, the service was good, the atmosphere was good, the food was all right, but it was just a bit more expensive than it should be for the type of operation being run here. In short: not bad, but overpriced.

I visited this T.G.I Fridays on a Saturday afternoon with my Bestfriend who I had not seen in months. Our visit lasted for about 5 hours but we enjoyed every hour we spent there. Our server was Bobby and he provided outstanding service. He was very attentive, friendly and he knew his products.Our food was delivered promptly and was cooked perfectly. I was also impress to see that the service manager Kevin took time visit each table to insure their dining experience was going well. Kevin also recommended that we try their delicious caramel salted cake dessert. This dessert was beyond delicious. I would highly recommend anyone to check out this location you cant go wrong with friendly staff and well cooked food. I will most definitely visiting again soon.

I like to find the good in almost any restaurant I go to. However, this TGI Fridays is the nastiest place in the area. The waiting staff is TERRIBLE, the food is TERRIBLE, it's not very clean, and did I mention how terrible the food is? Yes, I have been to TGI Friday's and have had some ok experiences. But having gone to this one I have pretty much sworn this place off forever. FOREVER! This is a chain restaurant at its WORST. After waiting forever for our waitress, who didn't seem like she even wanted to be there, I made the mistake of ordering fish and chips (I was hungry dammit!). What I ended up receiving were larger than average fish sticks that were dark brown and looked like they had been soaked in oil accompanied by soggy fries. Notice I said "soaked" and not "fried". Despite how disgusting they were I actually took a bite. Bad idea. As much as I hate doing it, I sent the food back and decided not to order anything. Another bad idea since the waitress proceeded to beg me to order something else. So I ordered something else, which was better but still less than adequate. I didn't even finish it, and when I don't finish the food it's BAD. The moral of this story is, if you like chain restaurants, live in a double wide and think Old Country Buffet is fine dining, go to this place because you will feel right at home. If you like food that is a.) edible and b.) edible, you definitely want to look elsewhere. Just keep driving down Rockville Pike until you see another restaurant. There are so many around here you will forget about this one as soon as you pass it.

I'm not sure why this place gets anything less than 4-5 stars. Wife and I dined there November 9. We decided to go here based on all the advertising on TV about their 2 for $20 special. (2 appetizers + 2 entrées for $20) It did NOT disappoint! Ok, so it's a bit noisy on a Saturday night with all the people at the bar watching the College games on TV, but the food is fantastic! Service was very prompt despite the place being busy. The best part....with 15% tip the bill came to $31.00

I used to love this place, but in recent years the quality has gone down and after our last visit I think it's going to be unlikely that we'll be going back. It's just a combination of service, cleanliness, quality of food-- not just one thing.

I absolutely love this Friday's the bartenders are the friendliness and the food is always right on point! My husband comes here regularly and we have request star points add-up.  Everything I've had here has been great!

I went to fridays on friday december 19 to celebrate my birthday dinner with friends. I was not satisfied. The food was mediocre at best. The waitress was nice but I barely saw her. I didn't get my drinks until 15 mins after ordering them. I didn't get the food til 1 hour. And it wasn't even that good! I for one will never be attending that restaurant again. Waste of my time and money. I suggest a better chef. Better and to be properly staffed on Friday nights.

I came here last Thursday to get a snack while taking a break from Reading at the nearby Barnes and Noble. I ordered the Key West Shrimp, which consists of two skewers of marinated (but it still was a bit bland) shrimp and a side of steamed broccoli. The meal was tasty enough, but more importantly fit within the parameters of my diet (something along the lines of a paleolithic diet). The service was pretty decent as well; I sat at the bar and the food arrived within ten to fifteen minutes.  The place was packed even on a Thursday Night, so I'd come here for lunch if I'm coming with company and anyone in my party is not in mood to wait in line to be seated.

Now anyone who knows me knows I don't do the chain restaurant thing if I can help it but I have one good friend who feels a certain sense of security in sameness so I always end up at a chain restaurant with him. In addition, this person does not see the lure of DC night life so we always end up in the 'burbs. Please trust that this person has some redeeming qualities.  Anywho, Friday's is getting a solid three stars because they have some pretty awesome late night deals for those people who don't value sleep and don't mind going to work drunk. Its like a happy hour for the despondent. $2 Oktoberfest and something like 25 cent wings is worthy of something, isn't it?

Its a good place to meet friends after work for cheap drinks, decent bar food and watch the game (with pop music playing over it). The bar runs a happy hour from 5 - 7 and 10 - close. Beers are either $2 or $3, a few of their mixed drinks were $4 (long island ice teas, margaritas, mojitos, and a few other drinks that I can't remember), and all appetizers (excluding the samplers and sliders) are priced half off. Wings were good, the Sesame Jack Chicken Strips tasted better than they looked, and the Loaded Potato Skins were satisfying. Service was good, although we're pretty sure they haven't learned all of their signature drinks (those overpriced girlie fruit drinks) since one of them didn't look anything like the picture in the menu. BTW, the pumpkin martini & punk pink are both very good. You're not going to get anything extraordinary here, but if you want just a cold drink and a quick bite, Friday's is a safe option.

I'm giving this place 2 stars as we were seated fairly quickly at 9PM.   Our waitress took forever to come -- we waited nearly 10 minutes for her to show up, and her service was lackluster at best.   I ordered the half ribs/shrimp combo - she never asked me what sides I wanted.    The shrimp was way too salty and the ribs were great. Beverage service sucked - we had to wait 10 minutes for a refill, even though she kept passing our table. I have never been a real fan of TGIF's and continued mediocre experiences will not make me return anytime soon. Save your money for a rainy day and go somewhere else.  Not worth it.

we had a really awesome waitress but the food took forever to come out. obviously not her fault as she kept coming to check up on us. when the food finally came out, it was overcooked, dry, and just plain bad. not sure how this place stays in business, but all the best to that waitress and whatever career she decides to embark on!

The food is great, but I'm not very with the service. Maybe because they were too busy. The Jack Daniels ribs is awesome,  as well as the steak.

After writing several restaurant reviews, I began to wonder whether there was any restaurant that deserved a ONE STAR rating. I thought about this for some time before coming up with TGI Friday's in Rockville. The place is clean enough. The food is passable (in more than one respect). The parking is fine. The atmosphere is what you might expect. The one thing this place lacks that eclipses all else is the service. The service sucks. I had a bad experience here several years ago during a family event (bad service, long waits) but decided to give it another chance. That second chance was worse.  The hostess sat us around the corner in a quiet booth, seemed nice. As we waited for a waiter, an employee kept walking by, disappearing into a rear stall, reappearing a few minutes later to return to work. This happened a few times over 30-40 minutes. Yeah, we waited to long but after a while it became a question of: "How long can they really ignore us?" Finally, frustrated that no one had even taken our order, I went to inspect the stall and found that the employee was visiting the rear stall to hork down a few quick bites during downtime. We then tracked down a different host (the first one had vanished) and discovered that we'd been seated in a "closed area" and the chowing employee never thought to alert someone that we were there.  This review might be a bit unfair. The restaurant management has likely changed in the last 5+ years since this event. Regardless, I have not been back to a TGI Friday's since and I doubt I ever will. You can't pay me (well, maybe you could) to deal with that sort of service. I didn't deserve it and they don't deserve my business. Maybe if they could give me a 40 minute life refund...
